Activity: Check emails, address feedback on resource usage visual feedback. Review progress.
Begin working on adding more detail and variety to the environment. Analyze the existing environment assets and identify areas for improvement.
Brainstorm ideas for new environment assets, such as foliage, rocks, and debris. Sketch out different concepts and consider how they would fit within the existing level design.
Gather reference images and materials for the new environment assets. Focus on creating realistic and visually appealing textures and models. Check out some artstation posts.
Lunch - maybe grab a sandwich from the corner deli?
Start creating the new environment assets using 3D modeling software. Pay attention to detail and ensure that the assets are optimized for performance.
Integrate the new environment assets into the game level. Experiment with different layouts and compositions to create visually interesting and immersive environments. Get initial feelings.
Playtest the updated level and gather feedback on the new environment assets. Make adjustments as needed.
